summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Dallas Board of Adjustment (Panel B) will convene on November 15, 2023, with a briefing at 10:30 A.M. followed by a public hearing at 1:00 P.M. at Dallas City Hall. The meeting aims to address various zoning and adjustment requests from residents and stakeholders.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes a staff presentation, public hearing for testimonies, and the review of the case docket. The Board will discuss uncontested items, holdover cases, and individual cases requiring decisions.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include several variance requests related to front yard setbacks and building height regulations, as well as special exceptions for landscaping and fence height regulations. Notable cases include applications from Maurice Wilson for variances at 2851 W. Jefferson Boulevard and from Jennifer Hiromoto for landscaping exceptions at 4200 Duncanville Road.

**Action Items**:  
The Board seeks approval for the minutes from previous meetings and will deliberate on the listed applications, including variances and exceptions. Decisions will be made on whether to grant the requested adjustments for the various properties discussed during the meeting. Public testimony will also be considered before final decisions are made.
